p: As for the above percentage reduction in new HIV infections, a 90% reduction in AIDS-related deaths was aimed for in the Fast-Track modelling between 2010 and 2030 [ 18]. The modelling of the impact resulting from reaching the different programmatic targets achieved a nearly 80% reduction by 2030 [ 18]. The 2016 UN high-level meeting adopted a target of 90% reduction by 2030 and 75% by 2020 for AIDS-related mortality, together with the corresponding programmatic target values [ 19].
